alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:04PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lincoln County through 745 PM MDT... At 702 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Boyero, or 18 miles southwest of Flagler, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain will limit visibility and cause hydroplaning. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Lincoln County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and will limit visibility and cause hydroplaning. Slow down and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle in front of you.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
